Page information Cite this page Get shortened URL Download QR code Download as PDF Printable version Wikimedia Commons Wikidata item An IT administrator system administrator sysadmin admin is a person who is responsible for upkeep configuration reliable operation of computer systems especially multi user computers such as servers system administrator seeks to ensure that uptime performance resources security of computers they manage meet needs of users without exceeding a set budget when doing so To meet these needs a system administrator may acquire install upgrade computer components software provide routine automation maintain security policies troubleshoot train supervise staff offer technical support for projects Related fields Many organizations staff offer jobs related to system administration In a larger company these may all be separate positions within a computer support Information Services IS department In a smaller group they may be shared by a few sysadmins even a single person Training Most employers 1 require a bachelor s degree in a related field such as computer science information technology electronics engineering computer engineering Some schools also offer undergraduate degrees graduate programs in system administration 2 3 4 5 6 In addition because of practical nature of system administration easy availability of open source server software many system administrators enter field self taught Generally a prospective employee will be required to have experience with computer systems they are expected to manage In most cases candidates are expected to possess industry certifications such as Microsoft MCSA MCSE MCITP Red Hat RHCE Novell CNA CNE Cisco CCNA CompTIA s A Network Sun Certified SCNA Linux Professional Institute Linux Foundation Certified Engineer Linux Foundation Certified System Administrator 7 among others Sometimes almost exclusively in smaller sites role of system administrator may be given to a skilled user in addition to in replacement of their duties Skills subject matter of system administration includes computer systems ways people use them in an organization This entails a knowledge of operating systems applications as well as hardware software troubleshooting but also knowledge of purposes for which people in organization use computers Perhaps most important skill for a system administrator is problem solving frequently under various sorts of constraints stress sysadmin is on call when a computer system goes down malfunctions must be able to quickly correctly diagnose what is wrong how best to fix it They may also need to have teamwork communication skills as well as being able to install configure hardware software Sysadmins must understand behavior of software in order to deploy it to troubleshoot problems generally know several programming languages used for scripting automation of routine tasks A typical sysadmin s role is not to design write new application software but when they are responsible for automating system application configuration with various configuration management tools lines somewhat blur Depending on sysadmin s role skillset they may be expected to understand equivalent key core concepts a software engineer understands That said system administrators are not software engineers developers in job title sense Particularly when dealing with Internet facing business critical systems a sysadmin must have a strong grasp of computer security This includes not merely deploying software patches but also preventing break ins other security problems with preventive measures In some organizations computer security administration is a separate role responsible for overall security upkeep of firewalls intrusion detection systems but all sysadmins are generally responsible for security of computer systems Duties A system administrator s responsibilities might include In larger organizations some of tasks above may be divided among different system administrators members of different organizational groups For example a dedicated individual s may apply all system upgrades a Quality Assurance QA team may perform testing validation one more technical writers may be responsible for all technical documentation written for a company System administrators in larger organizations tend not to be systems architects systems engineers systems designers In smaller organizations system administrator might also act as technical support database administrator network administrator storage SAN administrator application analyst See also
